bugs.description: Filter chips for specific coin types (e.g., '2022 American Silver Eagle Special Proof BU') only apply exact matches instead of showing all variations of the coin type.
stepsToReproduce: Click on a specific coin type chip (e.g., '2022 American Silver Eagle Special Proof BU').
Observe that the filter only applies to the exact match and does not include other variations of the coin type.
bugs.impact: Users cannot view all variations of a coin type when clicking on a filter chip, leading to incomplete search results.

bugs.description: Filter chips display incorrect styling on initial page load, but show correct styling after user interaction with filters.
stepsToReproduce: Load the page (refresh browser or open for first time).
Observe filter chips have wrong visual styling (colors, borders, etc.).
Change any filter setting or interaction.
Observe chips now display with correct styling.
bugs.impact: Poor first impression for users due to visual inconsistency on page load. Affects user experience but not functionality.

recentMessages.message: can you review our workflow and give me an outline
I'll analyze the project's workflow based on the available documentation and structure. Let me gather the relevant information first.
Can you generate a template file/script that i can use based ont his project to start a new project, like an onboarding prompt or something?

I've created a comprehensive project initialization template at /templates/project-initialization.md. This template incorporates best practices and patterns from StackTrackr while providing a generic structure that can be adapted for new projects.

If i wanted to start a new project and keep the overal visual style of this project, is that easy? for example could I ask you to make me a simple web page with a table and csv import, but use our existing theme, then we build a different back end on it?

Yes, absolutely! I can help you create a simplified version using StackTrackr's visual style and core components. We can extract the essential styling and functionality for a table-based interface with CSV import capabilities. Let me help you set that up.
Can you evaluate our site, and come up a theme template we can work from to eventually plan a user based theme feature?
I've created a comprehensive theme template at /templates/theme-template.md that builds upon StackTrackr's current theme system while providing a foundation for user-customizable themes.
so this template is currently wired into the site if we edit the md or is it just a reference?

This is currently just a reference template - it's not wired into the site. The current site uses a simpler theme implementation in js/theme.js and css/styles.css with the three built-in themes (light, dark, sepia).
Let's add it to our roadmap and use this template for planning on it's implementation
I've added the user-customizable theme system to the roadmap under 'NEW FEATURES' with a detailed breakdown of the implementation phases.
You're welcome! The theme system is now properly planned and documented with both the technical template and roadmap in place.
